page.title: 01Thursley and Bowlhead Green
page.content: The southern half of the block is farmland. Most of the fields are sown and fertilised grass; there is a smaller acreage of maize and fruit, some deciduous woodland and ponds developed for fish farming/ The A3 splits the hamlet of Bowlhead Green from the old village of Thursley and the new mobile-home park, and provides a speedway to jobs, shops and mainline stations. The original church at Thursley was Saxon and the houses are brick, stone and timber-framed. Many are occupied by retired people/ The northern half is heath with a few narrow belts of pine and a scattering of self-sown birch and pine. Part is owned by the Ministry of Defence and used for army training. The lowland heathland of Thursley Common is a National Nature reserve, owned by the Nature Conservancy Council.
